channels.name: major_media_breaking_news
channels.description: Cable news, major broadcast networks, and top-tier online news outlets (NYT, WaPo, AP, Reuters) running wall-to-wall breaking news coverage of the ASI announcement with live demonstrations and expert ...[truncated]
channels.experience_template: I was watching the news and every channel was covering OpenAI's live demonstration — they solved the Riemann Hypothesis on stream. It was everywhere.

channels.name: social_media_viral_spread
channels.description: Twitter/X, Reddit, Facebook, TikTok, and YouTube carrying clips, hot takes, memes, and viral threads about the ASI announcement — a chaotic mix of awe, skepticism, and panic.
channels.experience_template: My feed exploded overnight — clips of the ASI demo were everywhere, people losing their minds in the comments. Half the posts were calling it fake.

channels.name: tech_professional_network
channels.description: LinkedIn posts, Slack communities, Hacker News, specialized tech newsletters, and direct professional peer-to-peer communication among those in technology, research, and knowledge-work sectors.
channels.experience_template: A colleague forwarded me an internal memo and a Hacker News thread — the entire tech industry was in shock. Engineers I respect were saying this changes everything.

channels.name: word_of_mouth_community
channels.description: In-person conversations, family discussions, workplace talk, church, and community settings — second- and third-hand transmission of the news through personal social networks.
channels.experience_template: My neighbor brought it up at the block association meeting. She said her son who works in tech called her, completely shaken up. I hadn't heard anything about it yet.

channels.name: podcast_and_alternative_media
channels.description: Long-form podcasts, Substack newsletters, YouTube commentary channels, and ideologically-varied alternative media providing extended analysis and framing of the ASI event — ranging from techno-optimis...[truncated]
channels.experience_template: I caught a two-hour episode breaking down what OpenAI actually showed. The host was equal parts amazed and terrified — he had three AI researchers on and none of them agreed on what it meant.

rules.when: primary_info_source == 'Cable/broadcast TV news' or primary_info_source == 'Online news sites'
tech_adoption_posture in ('Early adopter', 'Innovator') or top_issue_2026 == 'AI/Technology' or employment_sector == 'Private sector' and education_level in ('Bachelor\'s degree', 'Graduate degree')
social_media_behavior in ('Active poster/Influencer', 'Occasional poster') and primary_info_source == 'Social media'
tech_adoption_posture == 'Early majority adopter' and employment_sector in ('Private sector', 'Self-employed', 'Gig/contract')
political_engagement_level == 'Highly engaged partisan' or asi_threat_perception in ('Existential threat', 'Enthusiastically positive')
age >= 40 and age < 60 and social_media_behavior in ('Passive consumer', 'Occasional poster')
